text: Liberal MP Tim Wilson says states need to "raise their own revenue and be held accountable for it”. Western Australian Liberal Senator Dean Smith proposed broadening the GST or increasing the rate to 12.5 per cent to eliminate payroll taxes - a move that could boost Australia's economy by $18 billion. The proposal would see sales taxes imposed on fresh food, health, childcare, private school and university fees for the first time. Mr Wilson told Sky News on Monday “when states receive money, spend money but are not responsible for collecting it then they will end up in a situation where they have little responsibility which is quite dangerous,” he said. “We need states and the Commonwealth to take responsibility... it can’t be about the Commonwealth taking responsibility and states getting a free ride.” Image: News Corp Australia
